question: Your eligibility notice
text:
Your eligibility notice
          
        

When you apply for coverage through Pennie, you'll receive an eligibility notice (either by postal mail or electronic mail, depending on the option you selected in your application) that explains your health coverage options through Pennie, as well as other programs you or other members may qualify for, including 
Medicaid and CHIP.
 This notice will also inform you about any additional steps you may need to take to confirm your eligibility for coverage and for financial assistance.
Make sure to read this notice carefully, and follow the guidance provided in the Next Steps section to enroll in the health coverage that is right for you and your family.
How are eligibility results determined?
What should I do if I think my eligibility results are wrong?
